intro: Hieracium atratum subsp. personatiforme, commonly known as the black hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its dark green, hairy leaves and yellowish-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along riverbanks. It has a rosette growth habit with basal leaves that are lance-shaped and have a rough texture. The subspecies personatiforme is distinguished by its more elongated leaves and slightly different flower structure compared to other forms of Hieracium atratum.
